description: Provides the foundation for advanced practice in pediatric critical care. Body system failure is examined as the potential common outcome from a variety of etiologic agents. The adaptation of children and their families to critical illness and intensive care is analyzed. Management strategies based on clinical decision making include nursing, medical, pharmacological, and other therapies and resources.
name: PRINCIPLES OF CRITICAL CARE NURSING OF CHILDREN I

section.name: PRINCIPLES OF CRITICAL CARE NURSING OF CHILDREN I
